summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO) report regarding an incident report against inmate Jeffrey Epstein for self-mutilation on July 23, 2019. The DHO found insufficient evidence, expunged the report, and imposed no sanctions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was charged with self-mutilation (Code 228) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York. The incident report was expunged due to insufficient evidence.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Staff member who delivered the advanced written notice of the charge to inmate Epstein on July 30, 2019.

persons.name: Unit Manager
persons.context: Staff member who advised inmate Epstein of his rights before the Discipline Hearing Officer on July 30, 2019.

connections.description: Lieutenant served the formal notice of charges to inmate Epstein.
Unit Manager advised Epstein of his rights regarding the disciplinary hearing.

events.title: Reported Self-Mutilation Incident
events.description: An incident report was filed alleging inmate Jeffrey Epstein committed the prohibited act of self-mutilation (Code 228) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

events.title: Notice of Charges and Rights Advisement
events.description: Inmate Epstein was given written notice of the charges by a Lieutenant and was advised of his rights before the Discipline Hearing Officer by a Unit Manager.

events.title: Discipline Hearing Officer Hearing
events.description: The DHO hearing was held. The DHO reviewed all evidence and found insufficient evidence to support the charge of self-mutilation.

events.title: Incident Report Expunged
events.description: The Discipline Hearing Officer finalized the report, expunging the incident report due to insufficient evidence. No sanctions were imposed.

locations: MCC New York, New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: An incident report was filed against Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019, for self-mutilation (Code 228) while he was incarcerated at MCC New York.
The Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO) found insufficient evidence to support the charge and expunged the incident report on August 1, 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein waived his right to a staff representative and did not request witnesses for the disciplinary hearing.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case files.
No sanctions were imposed on Epstein as a result of the expunged report.
